unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Pace Across India**
normalised: Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Pace Across India

unnormalised: New Delhi: The nationwide smart meter deployment under the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS) is gaining momentum, with significant progress reported in several states. Power distribution companies (DISCOMs) are actively installing smart meters to improve billing efficiency and reduce Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses, a persistent challenge in the Indian power sector.
normalised: New Delhi: The nationwide smart meter deployment under the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (R D S S) is gaining momentum, with significant progress reported in several states. Power distribution companies (D I S C O Ms) are actively installing smart meters to improve billing efficiency and reduce Aggregate Technical and Commercial (A T and C) losses, a persistent challenge in the Indian power sector.

unnormalised: Rajasthan Rajya Vidyut Utpadan Nigam Limited (RRVUNL) has announced the successful installation of over 50,000 smart meters by October 26, 2024, across Jaipur and nearby districts. Similar initiatives are underway in Uttar Pradesh, with Uttar Pradesh Power Corporation Limited (UPPCL) targeting complete smart meter coverage by December 31, 2025.
normalised: Rajasthan Rajya Vidyut Utpadan Nigam Limited (R R V U N L) has announced the successful installation of over fifty thousand smart meters by october twenty sixth, two thousand and twenty four, across Jaipur and nearby districts. unnormalised: The Ministry of Power expects the nationwide rollout to significantly improve grid stability and enable real-time energy accounting. Consumers are expected to benefit from Time of Day (ToD) tariffs, incentivizing them to shift consumption to off-peak hours. A consumer in Mumbai, Mrs. Sharma, noted a 15% reduction in her electricity bill after switching to a smart meter. Government officials plan to assess progress again at 14:00 hrs on 15/11/2024. Early estimates suggest reduced power theft translating to a potential saving of Rs. 2000 crores annually.
